label.en: 24/25 S regular part 1 3 CP P2OO Eng
label.et: 24/25 K PÕ 1. osa 3 EAP P2OO Eng

description.en:
In the first part of the course the students acquire the knowledge for tutoring: structure of University of Tartu, support services, study rules and regulations (structure of the curriculum, completion of the curriculum, organisation of exams, study legislation, good practices at the university etc), rights and obligations of students (academic leave, studying in other universities, extension of studies, RPL etc), study allowances and stipends and other social issues related to student life, the role of the tutor. 

In the seminars the social skills are learned, such as creating the contact and communication techniques, supporting adaptation and stress management, taking into account cultural differences, self-assertion, public speaking, problem-solving and cooperation skills. The tutorship is prepared by creating the action plan and making the self-analysis.


In the second part of the course the tutorship will be carried out. Tutor creates contact with his/her group of the admitted students already in summer, organises events and meetings in the beginning, as well during the semester, and is ready to be there for the concerns and questions of the first year students throughout the tutoring period. Learning from the experience is supported by the seminars and by writing the report and self-analysis.
description.et:
Õppeaine 1. osas omandatakse tuutoritegevuseks vajalikud teadmised Tartu Ülikooli struktuurist, tugiteenustest, õppetöö korraldusest ja reeglitest (õppekava ülesehitus, õppekava täitmine, eksamikorraldus, õppetööalased õigusaktid, head tavad ülikoolis jm), üliõpilase õigustest ja kohustustest (akadeemiline puhkus, teises (välis)kõrgkoolis õppimine, õpingute pikendamine, VÕTA jm), õppetoetustest ja stipendiumidest ja muudest üliõpilasi puudutavatest sotsiaalküsimustest, tuutori rollist ning välisüliõpilasi puudutavatest erisustest.

Seminarides käsitletakse sotsiaalseid oskusi nagu kontakti loomine ja suhtlemistehnikad, kohanemise ja stressiga toimetuleku toetamine, kultuurierinevustega arvestamine, enesekehtestamine, esinemis-, probleemilahendus- ja koostööoskus. Tuutorluseks valmistutakse tegevuse planeerimise ja eneseanalüüsi näol. 


Õppeaine 2. osas viiakse tuutoritegevus ellu. Selle käigus loob tuutor kontakti oma esmakursuslastega juba suvel, korraldab infotunde ja kohtumisi semestri alguses ja kestel ning on valmis esmakursuslastele küsimuste ja muredega pöördumiseks olemas olema kogu tuutorluse vältel. Kogemusest õppimist toetavad tuutorite seminarid ning tegevusaruande ja analüüsi kirjutamine.

objectives.en: The purpose of the course is to give knowledge and skills for tutorship and to support tutors' activities and self-development.
objectives.et: Ainekursuse eesmärgiks on anda tuutoritegevuseks vajalikud teadmised ja oskused ning toetada tuutorite tegevust ja enesearengut.

learning_outcomes.en:
In first part of the course, student acquires the theoretical knowledge and skills for tutoring and in the second part, student implements and develops those skills during the tutoring practice.
 
A student who has completed the course:
-knows the role of the tutor
-navigates independently in the study rules and regulations
-has the overview of social issues related to student life
-knows the structure of Universtiy of Tartu and knows where to find help when needed
-considers cultural differences in the activities
-shares the necessary information for getting started and coping with studies in Universtiy of Tartu
-supports students in adaptation process
-organises planned and purposeful events for students
-redirects students for counselling when needed
-implements social skills
-plans and analyses his/her actions and professional development
learning_outcomes.et:
Õppeaine 1. osas omandatakse tuutoritegevuseks vajalikud teoreetilised teadmised ja oskused ning 2. osas toimub nende rakendamine ja arendamine tuutoripraktika käigus.

Õppeaine läbinud üliõpilane: 
-teab tuutori rolli
-orienteerub iseseisvalt õppetöö korralduses ja reeglites
-omab ülevaadet üliõpilaselu puudutavatest sotsiaalküsimustest
-tunneb TÜ struktuuri ning teab, kust vajadusel abi otsida
-arvestab tegevustes kultuurierinevustega
-jagab ülikooliellu sisseelamiseks ja hakkamasaamiseks vajalikku infot
-toetab üliõpilasi kohanemisprotsessis
-korraldab kavandatult ja sihipäraselt üliõpilastele mõeldud sündmusi
-suunab üliõpilasi vajadusel nõustamiseks edasi
-rakendab sotsiaalseid oskusi
-planeerib ja analüüsib oma tegevust ja professionaalset enesearengut

independent_work.et:
In e-learning there are weekly homeworks (tests and writing tasks) with weekly deadlines. 
For the seminar homework, student needs to create an action plan and self-analysis. 
Instructions can be found in Moodle.

description.et:
In Moodle independent works submitted on time:  
- tests completed with one trial during the given time at least for the result of 50%,
- writing tasks (including action plan and self-analysis for seminar homeworks) with at least two trials completed at least for the result of 75%. The programme manager of the curriculum has the possibility to read the tutor's action plan.
The final test in Moodle completed on time, with one trial during the given time at least for the result of 50%.

grade_evaluation.et: For getting the course passed, student needs to submit all the homeworks and attend all the seminars. The final results of the course will be out by May 12 the latest.

debt_elimination.et:
When submitting the writing tasks on time, it is possible to resubmit the task during one week after announcement of the result in order to reach the level of 75% or above.

Attendance at seminars is obligatory. Student can be absent from the opening seminar and at maximum from one of the other seminars only with substantial reason. In case of absence additional homework must be submitted. 

Exceptional circumstances previously agreed with the teaching staff will be considered separately.

resources.mandatory_materials:
- Materials in Moodle
- UT Study Regulations (ut.ee/studreg)

audience.et: There are no prerequisites. The target group: I and II level students who have the willingness to help other students and to get acquainted with UT study organisation. The course is not meant for students from programmes coordinated by other university.
